text: i feel the command ./peer peer is strange, why not just use. /peer run or ./peer start
<@U12452RAP>: you’re not the only one :simple_smile: discussion at <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/issues/1158>

attachments.title: CLI "peer" command would be better called "start" · Issue #1158 · hyperledger/fabric · GitHub
attachments.text: The CLI commands are: peer Runs the peer. status Returns status of the peer. stop Stops the running peer. This means that to start a peer one has to type: "./pe...
attachments.fallback: GitHub: CLI "peer" command would be better called "start" · Issue #1158 · hyperledger/fabric
